$description: Skeleton component tokens. Skeletons are placeholder loading indicators that mimic the shape of content. These tokens compose primitive tokens into skeleton-specific configurations. Use skeletons for: initial page loads, lazy-loaded content, data fetching states. Prefer skeletons over spinners when the layout structure is known. ACCESSIBILITY: Use aria-busy on the container and aria-hidden on skeleton elements.

borderRadius.$description: Skeleton border radius variants for different content shapes.

text.$description: Text skeleton border radius (4px). Slight rounding for text line placeholders.

circle.$description: Circle skeleton border radius (full). Use for: avatar placeholders, icon placeholders.

default.$description: Default skeleton border radius (4px). General-purpose shape for rectangular content blocks.

height.$description: Skeleton height presets for common content shapes.

text.$description: Text line skeleton height (14px). Approximates a single line of body text.

heading.$description: Heading skeleton height (24px). Approximates a heading line.

avatar.$description: Avatar skeleton height (40px). Matches medium avatar size for consistent placeholder.

duration.$description: Animation cycle duration (1.5s). Slow enough to be subtle, fast enough to indicate loading.

easing.$description: Animation easing. Smooth ease for gentle pulsing effect.
